text: ANNIE (20) stumbles out the front door of her parent's lakeside home. She's in her pajamas, - wearing red pumps. moves with urgency and a primal fear. She looks back as she runs, turning onto the street. We hear the screen door open and close again. Annie slows down, a few houses down. She stops and turns towards her home, standing in the center of the street. Street lamps and oak trees line the block. It's quiet. Annie stares ahead - seeing something - she starts to back up. One step. Then another. Click of heels on concrete. Slowly, tracking backwards, Annie remains focused on some - fearful. We see nothing. Nearby, a young couple, pulling groceries from their car notice Annie walking in the street. The WOMAN steps towar the sidewalk - concerned.
Hey, are you ok? Annie nods to the woman, but remains focused on something else.
You need some help?

No. The woman shrugs to her husband and turns away. Annie turns - aware of something closing in. She continue stepping backwards. A door opens. ANNIE'S FATHER steps onto his front porch, frazzled. He looks around and sees Annie in the street.
Annie! What are you doing? Annie looks to her dad, then back to the street - continu to move away.
I'm fine, dad. (CONTINUED)
Where are you going?
Nowhere. Annie looks back to her dad and the open door. She sprint forward, rounding her imagined chaser. Annie races across the lawn towards her father.

What the hell, Annie? She hops onto the porch, flashes a smile to her dad and r into the house. Confused, her father follows her. It's quiet again outside. The couple carry their grocerie inside. Moments later, Annie runs out the front door, keys in han purse over her shoulder. She sidesteps across the porch and climbs into her car. Starting the engine, Annie speeds away as her father runs outside once more.
Annie drives down a dark street - with wild abandon. The radio is on. Her cell phone rings from inside her purse on the passeng seat.

Annie's car is parked at the edge of a beach. The driver' side door is open. The headlights are on. Near the water, Annie sits alone in the wet sand, facing car. A ring tone chimes - muffled through the cloth of her pur She stares. Focused. Terrified. Annie looks ahead at the shadow-filled horizon of sand. L night mist flows across the beams of her car headlights. Reaching into her bag, Annie grabs her cell phone and pre a button. She's nearly crying as she holds the phone to h ear. (CONTINUED)
Dad? Hi. I love you... She listens - watching her surroundings. The water contin to splash lightly behind her.

I know. I know. I just wanted you and mom to know how much I love you. Annie stares ahead. We see her point-of-view - headlights beaming down across the sand, illuminating her footprints dark trees shift and sway. We hold on this frame, even as Annie continues to speak..
I'm sorry I can be such a shit to you sometimes. I don't know why I do that. Just know that I love you, ok? I just really... love you both...

A hard-cut reveals... Harsh morning sunlight on the sand and lake. Peaceful sou Annie is laying along the shore. Her body is pale and sti She's dead. Her jaw hangs open - head slumped to the side Blue lips and face - covered with bug bites. Her leg is twisted back - violently rotated in its socket - a piece bone visible near the knee’s twisted skin. Her red pump dangles from her foot, over her chest. Legs open. Somethi awful and provocative. Water or something viscous has soaked her pajama bottoms, creating a small wet circle in the sand near her waist. A seagull pulls at a piece of skin near her toes. Cutting back to the now familiar POV shot facing the car the trees, we see two young kids looking at the body. A s and her younger brother. They stand, looking down - almos frozen by the sight. The little boy holds a kite in his h In the sunlight, it might be possible to distinguish Anni footsteps leading down from her open car door, the childr footsteps leading up to their current position, and a thi set of footprints at the far left of frame. This third se leads up to Annie and then recedes back into the treeline The waves continue to roll.

JAIME "JAY" HEIGHT, a pretty 19 year old girl, relaxes in hot tub - sipping a cola. Droplets of sweat dot her cheek forehead. A breeze pushes a swarm of white dandelion seeds through air, swirling past the young woman's face. Jay stares up at a couple of birds hopping along the tele wire overhead. She smiles as they hop and peck - sharing food. A squirrel races along the wire causing the birds to fly Jay looks down - stretching her arms out in the hot water She looks at her hands and legs immersed in bubbles. The bright sun reflects against the surface. Something irritates her shoulder. Jay turns her head and at her upper arm just above the water. She sees a tiny re moving toward her elbow. She watches it closely for a moment, then lowers her arm the water, dispelling the tiny insect in a swirl. The glass door slides open - KELLY, Jay's 17-year-old sis leans out from the doorway in her summer clothes - it’s a Indian Summer.
Hey Jay.
What's up?
Nothing. Paul and Yara are here. We're gonna watch a movie if you feel like it?
Thanks, I'm going out actually.
That guy?
Yeah. Kelly swings a bit - hanging onto the door handle. She fl her hair up with a goofy smile and looks to her sister.
I like him. (CONTINUED)

Yeah me too. Kelly steps inside and slides the door half-shut. Across the backyard fence, Jay notices movement in the neighboring yard. Looking closely, she sees two pairs of eyes peeking out f pile of lumber. The NEIGHBOR BOYS spy on her through the link fence. A couple dumb little kids - ages 8 and 11. Jay gives them a dirty look and points.
I see you. The boys duck down out of view.
Don't you have a video game to play or an animal to torture? Jay slides deeper into the tub. She holds her mouth just above the surface of the water.

Jay walks inside, wrapped in a towel, her hair wet. In the adjoining living room, Kelly sits with her friends watching a bad comedy. They're sprawled across the furnit On tv: a man talks with his English-speaking dog about th woman he loves. The dog offers bad romantic advice. PAUL, 17, eats cheese curls on the lounge chair. YARA, 17, is slumped into the couch cushions with her leg across the coffee table; a pair or glasses on her nose. S reads an ebook on her pink-shell-compact smartphone, stil managing to laugh at the television. Jay stops alongside Kelly and watches a moment of the mov Jay smiles and waves to Yara, who glances up just long en to see who's around.
What are you reading?
The Idiot. (CONTINUED)
Is it good?
I don't know yet. It's about Paul. Paul makes a face toward Yara - irritated. Jay leans over the couch, letting water drip onto her sis face. Kelly swats her away.
Hey Jay.
(smiling at the bunch) Hey Paul. MRS. HEIGHT, Jay's mom, drinks wine and smokes in the din room - chatting on the telephone. Laughing.

(into phone) Oh no I'd love to. That sounds fun. I could come over and cook for you if you'd like. I make a really delicious quiche. Do you like quiche? The woman continues to flirt and smile through the teleph receiver. For a mother, she is awkward and shy. Without looking up, Yara mumbles a statement over the hok music of the movie.
Hey, I have an idea...
What? Yara casually farts, staring down at her telephone screen

Oh... it got away. Kelly and Paul laugh and grimace as Yara grins like a chi She scrolls and swipes, reading the novel on her phone. Jay raises her brow and heads for the hallway. Paul turns and glances at Jay as she walks away - eyeing older girl. Yara and Kelly notice him staring at Jay. They smile to e other - aware that he's love-struck and hopeless.

Jay adjusts her blouse in the mirror. She looks at hersel admiring and critiquing. Leaning close to her reflection, she puts on her make-up. A polaroid on the mirror shows her drinking a beer with P at a dark indoor swimming pool - much younger. Dirty clothes hang from chairs or sit in piles along the floor. Old dolls boxed in a corner. A scuffed and dirty yearbook. Things covered in dust - all bathed in the gree orange haze of summer light through curtains and a nearly imperceptible post-adolescent mist. Jay moves a lock of hair across her forehead - finessing placement - being picky. She laughs at herself and blows a gust of air up - causin bangs to flip. From across the room we watch the rest of the scene: Jay walks to her dresser and grabs a pill bottle from ato She opens the plastic container, pops out a pill and swal it. No water necessary. Jay sets the bottle down and re-examines her outfit and s in the mirror. A pose - how does my ass look? Ok. A coy glance at herself. A funny bug-eyed face. A raspber from buzzed lips and exhaled air. We hear a deep rumbling as the camera pushes in towards t mirror, moving tightly on Jay's lips as she covers them i dark pink lipstick.

Jay stands alongside her date, HUGH (21), waiting in a lo line to buy tickets. They stand under the marquee, lookin out at the street and the passing crowds. Hugh has a look of contentment on his face. The couple ki A woman behind them glares and makes a face - jealous and irritated by their public affection. They don't notice - us.
You ever play the "trade game"? (CONTINUED)
No. What is it?
It's a people watching game. My sister and I used to play it when we were bored.
(teasing) You're bored right now? Jay smiles and shakes her head in playful frustration.
(stern but loving) No. Shut up. Let me finish.
Alright, how do we play?
OK. You start by watching the crowd - casually scope out the people around us. Hugh turns and looks at the people at the rear of the lin then toward a group near the lobby.
Ok.
Now without telling me, pick one person that you'd like to trade places with. It could be anybody. For whatever reason. Hugh nods and scans the crowd. Jay does the same.
Ok. I got one.
So now I get 2 guesses to figure out who you picked and why you want to trade places with ‘em.
Alright. Good luck. Jay looks around the crowds of people on the street. She zeroes in on a very large man with a long beard. (CONTINUED)
Him. Jay giggles and points casually at the big man. Hugh look and laughs, shaking his head.
No.
You could pick up cars and throw them if you were that guy.
Yeah, but he's not my pick.
Waiting in line for popcorn with Hugh, Jay looks around t elegant lobby. She notices a well dressed, good looking g talking to a hot blonde in a short dress.
That guy. Hugh shakes his head - no.
I figured you'd wanna sleep with the hot blonde.
Nope. She's not even cute. Jay rolls her eyes. Hugh is clearly lying about the woman attractiveness.
Ok. Who was your trade? Hugh looks over at a couple standing by the stairs with t little boy - feeding him movie theater junk food.
Him.
The dad?
No. The son. How cool would it be to have your whole life ahead of you? Jay shrugs - thinking about it. (CONTINUED)
Come on. It's not like you're an old man. You're 21.
I know. But look how happy that kid is. Plus, at that age you can go to the bathroom anytime you want. Total freedom.
Yes, he's probably taking a shit right now.
Exactly. I could never get away with that. Jay shakes her head and smiles.
With popcorn and drinks in hand, Jay and Hugh take their seats. Jay starts to scope out the theater and nearby pat The organist plays an overture.
Ok. My turn. Jay looks around, turning back to see the rear of the the
I got mine. Hugh smiles as he eyes the surrounding crowd - enjoying t game. Jay watches with anticipation.
How about the girl in the yellow dress?
Where?
There.
Uh... I don't see her.
Right there. (CONTINUED)
Jay stares - confused - she sees no one - same as the audience. Hugh points at an empty space near the curtaine entrance. There is NO girl in a yellow dress - anywhere.
Are you teasing me? Hugh looks at his date and begins to realize she's not kidding. His face changes. He stares back at the walkway focused on something or someone unseen by us.
Hugh, I'm sorry I just don't know who you're talking about, but that's not who I picked... Jay's smile starts to fade.
I'm sorry.
No. What's wrong? Hugh glances back quickly, starting to stand up.
I don't think I feel like watching a movie.
Why? What's going on? Hugh sets his drink down. Jay stares at him, looking for explanation.
I don't feel good all of a sudden. Hugh is fidgeting - sweaty.
Oh. Well we don't have to watch the movie. You need to go home? Hugh turns his head and looks to the back of the theater. stares. Jay notices but doesn't say anything.
Um, let's just go to the car.
Ok. (CONTINUED)
Hugh takes Jay’s hand and leads her to the side exit, shuffling past movie-goers as they step into the sunlight
Jay walks with Hugh towards the parking lot. She notices glancing back - looking for something. His demeanor has changed. Something is wrong.
Did you see somebody that made you wanna leave? Hugh shakes his head.
Like an ex-girlfriend or something? You said there was a girl in a yellow dress. Was it someone you knew?
No. I just felt sick. I feel better being outside.
Jay sits next to Hugh. He drives the car down the highway silent. Jay turns from Hugh and stares ahead. She buckles her sea belt and watches the road - unsettled.

Jay sits across from Hugh in a cozy booth, looking out at street through a large window. They're eating Italian food. Jay smiles and leans forward, cat-like, stealing a sip fr Hugh’s wide glass of beer. Hugh glances outside. Jay touches his hand. A moment of flirting. Through a slow zoom, we move past the couple, focusing on distant intersection of pedestrians outside the window. T but visible, a poor working class family walk together al the sidewalk. The kids have ice cream. The parents smoke heavily. A tall and very thin man crosses the road, movin toward the restaurant - he coughs and hacks into his fore  11 12 13 13.

Hugh's car is parked on the street near Jay's house. The are making out passionately. Mid-kiss, Hugh peeks out the window, looking into the dar night. Jay pulls away from the kiss and reaches for Hugh's pants zipper. He gently guides her away.
I want to, but... Jay looks at Hugh - worried that she did something wrong.
My stomach... still... Jay gets it. She smiles and nods.
Ok.
I'll see you soon?
Yeah.
Bye.
Bye. Jay climbs out and jogs up to her front porch, pulling ou keys. Hugh drives off with a wave.
Jay drives her car along the crowded I-75 expressway - in the city. Detroit is grey and flat. A radio DJ comments on the Indian Summer.
With backpack over shoulder, Jay walks along the half emp path. Campus buildings loom. Old architecture resting on broken sidewalks.  14 15 14.

Jay eats fast food alone at a table. She watches other students pass through the large modern corridor. Jay chews and looks down at her drink. A paper cup. A plastic lid. A straw. The chatter mixes together into a blur of voices.
A LITTLE GIRL on a distant porch covers her eyes and coun 10. Her friends run and scatter behind bushes and garbage cans.

7...8...9...10... here I come! A bunch of LITTLE KIDS are playing FREEZE TAG on a distan front lawn. They scream and laugh as they run from each o Once tagged, they stand frozen, until someone else crawls under their legs and frees them. Jay walks with Kelly down the sidewalk, drinking Slurpees They pass by the children's game in progress. Kelly pulls out a pack of cigarettes and lights one. She takes a drag.
Thanks for walking with me. The two girls step leisurely down the block.
Mom knows you smoke.
Yeah, but she'll cry if she actually sees it happening.
Or she'll steal your cigarettes. Kelly shakes her head. Jay takes a sip from her drink. She looks out at the gree lawns and clean suburban stretch ahead of her.
How's it going with Hugh? (CONTINUED)
Good. Mostly. He was acting kind of weird last night.
Why?
I don't know. He said he wasn't feeling good, but it seemed like something was on his mind. Kelly exhales - stepping down the street. Jay looks at Kelly starts An old woman animal as it
Have you... um...? her sister.
No. I know he wants to... but last night... he seemed different. to laugh at her sister.
(teasing dryly) Maybe he's a virgin?
He's not. I mean, I don't know for a fact, but... no.
So what's the problem?
I don't know. approaches, walking her dog. The girls pet the passes.
(looking at her dog) She loves the attention.
Yeah. The woman walks on and the girls resume their journey hom
You're still... ? (CONTINUED)
Me? Jay nods.
You haven't... ? Kelly looks at Jay - then finally understands what she's getting at.
I haven't slept with anybody. Not for any real big reason or anything. I will... eventually. Maybe soon. Any minute now.
Whenever.
Yeah.
What about Paul?
Ehhh. We kissed once and it didn't feel right. He's more like a brother... although he's kind of in love with you. So I don't know what that means. Jay smiles and thinks about it for a moment.
It'd be like fucking my step-brother. Kelly starts to laugh.

Gross. The two sisters smile and share a laugh. They pass before a modest house with a pristine lawn. A fighting couple - possibly a girl mid-tantrum - can be he inside. We see Jay's POV as she stares at the brick ranch home, passing it slowly. She shakes it off and continues the suburban block. The yelling fades. Kelly takes a final drag, then tosses her cigarette into street. (CONTINUED)
Do I smell bad? Jay leans over and smells her younger sister.
You smell like cherry coke, banana nicotine.
That's my favorite flavor.
Mom's gonna love it. Kelly slurps her drink - making a funny sound through the straw. Jay smiles - walking through her sunny neighborhoo looking around at the street she grew up on.
It's weird still being here. It’s like... everybody else went away to school, but me.
Dad said he'd pay for you to go away.
I'm not sure I even want to. It's all kind of useless isn't it? I mean, degrees don't get people jobs. At least not good ones. Look at mom.

Then why are you even taking classes, dumb-ass? Nearing their own house, Jay notices a very HANDSOME youn washing his car in a driveway across the street. GREG HANNIGAN, 21, sees them. He waves casually - without a sm
She won't let me stay here if I don't. Kelly waves back. Jay simply nods to him - walking along avoiding too much eye contact.
When I graduate, I'm getting the hell outta here. I wanna go to college somewhere that doesn't have shitty weather.
Ok. I'll visit. (CONTINUED)
Greg resumes his car washing, watching Jay as she nears h front porch. He seems very focused on the young woman.

Hugh holds Jay's hand, leading her down a dark path into woods. A six pack dangles from his thumb. Still visible, car headlights shine through the trees. Moonlight casts a soft glow over the area. Hugh carries a small bag over his shoulder.

Where are you leading me? Hugh turns and shushes her nicely - a finger to his lips. Jay smiles and keeps walking, sticking close to her date. They move deeper and deeper into the dark and foreboding forest. A bird calls from a craggy and deadened tree. Jay peers i the dark as something scampers by. Hugh looks around as he walks - always turning and watchi

Towels hang from an old log near a small lake - black and in the night - surrounded by trees. Hugh kicks off his boxers and wades into the water, gulpi his beer. He smiles looking back at Jay. She steps to the edge of the lake, happy and excited, though shyly coverin chest as she takes off her clothes. Jay grabs her beer from the mud and walks into the water, joining Hugh. She laughs as she steps deeper.
The bottom feels gross.
It's better over here. Jay reaches Hugh and he pulls her closer, kissing her. Hugh watches the woods, while making out with the girl. H eyes are focused.
Maybe we shouldn't. (CONTINUED)
I want to.
Me too, I just...
You like me?
I do. Jay kisses him harder, pressing closer - it's getting hea Hugh pulls back and looks around, watching the trees and clearing.
What? Nobody's here. Hugh nods. She's right, but he keeps scanning the woods. Peeking around. Jay watches him - puzzled and ready - she raises her brow.
Let's go to the car. More kissing.
Yeah?
Yeah. Hugh nods as he rubs his hands over Jay's back. She moves with him - their energy and tension increasing.

Jay has a bead of sweat along her forehead. She holds her arms tightly around Hugh in the back seat of the car. Jay breathes heavily, her body pulsing from very recent s aerobic activity. Their clothes sit in a pile along the f of the car. A tiny smile crosses her face as she sits resting on Hugh lap. They breath in unison. Rising and falling together. Jay grins as she kisses Hugh's ear. Hugh looks ahead with cold and frightened eyes. Something on his mind. Something isn't right. He hides his face amongst Jay's post-coital affection.  19 20 20.

The old Ford sits at the back of a dark, dirt lot. Woods an old factory surround the car. We watch from a distance faint silhouettes move within the vehicle. One of the back doors opens and Hugh climbs out, pulling his boxers. He walks around the car and opens the trunk. Partially obscured, we wait as he attends to something at back of the car. The clinking of bottles and junk. The sound of a beer can opening.
It's funny, I used to daydream about being old enough to go on dates and drive around with friends in their cars. Some viewers might notice the absence of a license plate.
Jay lays across the length of the back seat, resting on h stomach. She kicks her heels up playfully as she pokes he head out the open door. We hear the trunk close. The sound of footsteps.

I had this image of myself holding hands with a really cute guy, listening to music on the radio and driving along a pretty road... maybe somewhere up north... after the trees started to change color. Opening the opposite rear door, Hugh crawls inside the ca laying across Jay. He kisses the back of her neck. Caress the side of her bare waist. Jay grins as Hugh kisses her. She rests her cheek on the leather seat. Deep and slow breaths.
It was never about going anywhere... just having some kind of freedom I guess. Now we're old enough, but where the hell do we go right? Then with force and quickness - (CONTINUED)

Hugh pushes a small cloth over Jay's mouth. She tries to away, but he holds her head down until her eyes close. Sh stops struggling. Jay rests quietly again - a cheek on the leather seat. A open mouth. A drop of drool. A long and deep breath. Darkness. The sound of wood being dragged across a concrete floor. A metal door closes. Footsteps. Breathing. Jay slowly opens her eyes.

Jay looks around the old factory floor. A giant open spac lit dimly by moonlight and distant street-lamps. Several stories up, treetops line the windows. Hugh walks along the far edge of the space, waving a flashlight out windows and down long running hallways. Jay half-focuses her eyes. She takes a few deep breaths. The girl is drowsy - still under the chemical spell of an inhaled narcotic. Looking down, Jay sees her arms and legs tied tightly to wheelchair. She squirms and pulls but she can't move. Her body isn't fully responsive. Hugh looks back from across the warehouse floor.

Jay? Are you awake? Jay stares across the darkness at Hugh as he slowly walks over. She tugs lightly against the rope and cloth bonds. eyes sag within their sockets. Hugh stops in front of her. He leans down and looks at he face. He looks frightened. His eyes are watery. His face red - like he's been crying.
I'm sorry. Jay tries to talk. Drool edges out the crease of her mout
Whuuuttt aarrhhh youuhhh doingggggg? (CONTINUED)

I'm not gonna hurt you. Don't worry. Jay stares at him with deep fear. Hugh turns and shines his flashlight into the darkness. H scans the room. Jay watches. She opens her mouth as if to yell, but it's nothing but a hollow gasp - a mimic of a dry heave. Hugh shushes her with a gesture and continues waving the of light around the warehouse.
You won't believe me, but I need you to remember what I'm saying. Jay stares in fright.
Jay nods her head - ok.
This thing... Hugh looks around the room slowly.
..-It's gonna follow you. Jay eyes Hugh with growing concern. This is getting worse Hugh points his light towards a distant doorway. It's emp Jay pulls against her ties - trying to get free.
(with a gasp) Hellllppppppp. Hugh turns and looks at Jay's pretty face.
Somebody gave it to me. I passed it to you... back in the car. Jay's eyes widen - terrified.
It can look like people you know... or it can be a stranger in a crowd... whatever helps it get close to you. (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

HUGH (cont'd) Sometimes I think it looks like people you love just to hurt you... scare you... make fun of you. Hugh stands up and rushes to a nearby window. He aims his light outside towards the ground.

I see it. Jay cranes her neck up trying to look out the far-off win She sees nothing. Hugh runs over and wheels Jay's chair towards the window. looks out and down towards the adjacent field. It's dark, she catches a glimpse of a middle-aged, naked woman slowl walking around the corner of the building. Jay's eyes show fear and shock.
Whhhoooo isss?? Hugh wheels Jay back to the center of the room.
You can get rid of it. Sleep with someone else as soon as you can. Just pass it on. If it gets you, it'll come after me... you understand?

No. Jay starts to cry. Hugh shushes her. The room is quiet. Hugh looks around - listening. They wait - longer still. We see Jay's eyes in close-up as she watches. We see her point-of-view: empty halls and dark doorways. Nothing still. Then... There's a shuffling sound from a distant hallway. Hugh po his light into the darkness. (CONTINUED)

Jay cries in silence, looking towards the beam of light a far end of the warehouse. Finally... A naked middle-aged woman emerges from the very distant shadows - slowly walking. Jay watches - puzzled and scared.
Whooo isszzz atttehh? The naked woman, still far away, creeps along staring at
Whudddda fucckk d'youu wannnttt??? The woman contorts the muscles in her mouth - oddly - revealing teeth and tongue. She continues walking forward Jay cringes and looks to Hugh.

Jay, I'm doing this to help you... so you know it's real. Hugh points his flashlight at the woman as he circles clo to her. Hugh stands along the edge of the woman's path, waving slightly in her direction. She doesn't look at him - only Jay. Jay shakes in her chair, pulling at her restraints. She stares up at the naked woman - still over 50 feet away.
Ehhhhh. Noooo... The middle-aged woman opens her mouth again, straining th muscles in her throat.

Huuughhhhh! Another step closer. And another. Hugh runs across the room and spins the wheelchair around pushes Jay down the darkened hall as the nude woman follo behind. Jay stares ahead in shock - passing rotting walls and rus industrial equipment. (CONTINUED)
Never go anywhere that doesn't have more than one way out. It's very slow, but it's not dumb. Jay looks down at her bare legs and the passing floor. He eyes are heavy.
Tires kick up dirt. From a distance, we watch as the old Ford swerves around corner and drives off down the road - racing away from th abandoned building.

Kelly sits on the stoop of her front porch with her neighborhood friends. They're playing 'Old Maid'. Paul po liquor from his flask into a Coke can. Yara reads from he pink-shell-compact cell phone while sorting her hand of c
Can I have some?

Yeah. Paul hands Kelly the can of pop. She takes a sip and crin from the taste. Gross. Kelly shakes off the sting of cheap booze and examines he cards. She holds the old maid card - unfortunately. She tries to maintain her poker face while looking back a Paul.

(veading from her cell phone) Listen to this... “I think that if one is faced by inevitable destruction -- if a house is falling upon you, for instance -- one must feel a great longing to sit down, close one's eyes and wait, come what may...”
That's why we're drinking on the porch. Paul grins and looks over at Kelly. Yara mutters a fake l (CONTINUED)
Your mom asleep already?
Almost for sure. Yeah. She wakes up at 5:15. I think that would kill me. We push in slowly towards Kelly's hand of cards - centere the Old Maid - an ugly caricature of a spinster.
Yeah that's rough.
I never wanna have a job. Yara's eyes dart excitedly over her cell phone screen. Sh smiles and nods to herself - enjoying some undisclosed pr
I wish I didn't.
You love serving hot dogs and ice cream to weird old people and crying children.
Ok. That's true. It brings me joy. Yara rolls her eyes at Kelly's goofiness.
Where's Jay at?
Oh. On a date This bit of information seems to sting Paul. He covers it much as possible. Kelly looks to him, holding up her hand cards.
Your turn.
Who is he?
Somebody new.
Of course. (CONTINUED)
Kelly gives Paul a dirty look as he grabs a card - the ol maid remains in her hand.
Your sister is so pretty. It's annoying.
It is annoying.

At least she's nice. Yara gives Paul a dirty look. He smirks back and she kick him in the leg. The old Ford Galaxy races up the street and stops in fron the house. Kelly and her friends turn and watch as Hugh r out and opens the back door on the far side of the car. T engine is still running. Kelly and her friends watch as Hugh pulls something from backseat. Kelly begins to stand.
Is everything ok?! Hugh closes the rear door, stepping over something as he back toward the driver's seat.

(pointing back at the ground) Don't let it touch you! Slamming his door shut, Hugh drives off, revealing Jay in middle of the road. Still tied and bound in her underwear crawls toward the curb - trying to walk.

Jay! Kelly drops her cards and jumps from the porch - confused Jay tries to stand up and move closer to the outer sidewa she fails - falling in the grass. Kelly rushes across the front lawn toward her sister. Pau and Yara follow behind.
GREG, Jay's handsome neighbor, pulls a beer from the frid and rounds the hallway. (CONTINUED)

Wearing sweat pants and a ragged t-shirt, he takes a sip approaches the front door. His hair is a mess - styled by pillow. His mother, MRS. HANNIGAN, peeks through the screen door flashing police lights shine through the front curtains o home. Greg joins her, looking out at the street scene: a series of police cars, an ambulance and an assortment of people. Jay sits on her porch, covered in a blanket, surrounded b emergency workers. Her mother, in a robe, talks with a po officer near the garage. The other kids mill about the property as neighbors peek pass by. There's a mist in the night air, covering the suburban lawn. Greg and his mother watch. The young man sips his beer. Through the screen, Greg sees Jay talking with the cops.
What happened?
I don't know. Greg watches the scene - the glare of ambulance lights. H face shows concern.
Those people are such a mess. Greg stares ahead - ignoring his mother.
Jay is mid-conversation with a police officer. She sits, covered in her blanket, looking across at the man.
It was consentual? Jay nods her head.
Yeah. Jay looks back at the policeman - her eyes are tired and
And you'd never seen the woman before? (CONTINUED)
No. Jay shakes her head and touches her legs - focusing on he fingers stretched across her bare knees - losing herself thought.
Ok. Have you ever been to his home?
Not inside, but I know where it is. I waited in the car for him once. He didn't want me to come in. He said he was embarrassed about where he lived. The cop nods as he writes in his notebook.

Jay is in an emergency room partition. A doctor examines her - performing a test for STDs. Jay lays there - sad and still. Her breathing is loud and - each inhalation shown in labored slow-motion. Pronounce anxiety through Jay's eyes. The camera begins to shake as it pushes towards the bed. hollow rumble fills the soundscape...

Mrs. Hannigan drinks coffee at the table across from Jay' mom. Mrs. Height takes her time pouring some sugar into h own coffee. She mixes in some Irish liquor and takes a si There's a long sigh after the drink.
She didn't catch anything did she?
They don't think so.
Poor Jaime.
Apparently he used a fake name to rent a house in the city. The police searched the place, but they can't find him.
My god. (CONTINUED)

It breaks my heart. The things he said to her. So weird and sick. Mrs. Hannigan shakes her head in sadness as she drinks mo coffee - looking around the room at the wall of family ph Jay and Kelly smile brightly in front of wooded backdrops childhood portraits. In one faded picture, young Jay smiles awkwardly, leaning her grandfather's shoulder - peaking at camera. The old r haired man grins alongside Jay's mother and father.
The storm door is open. The wind rustles the trees.
The neighborhood is quiet and mostly empty. Birds chirp. car passes near the main road.
Beyond the trees of the middle-class suburban neighborhoo the concrete towers of a nuclear power plant are visible the distance.
A few kids laugh and play near a jungle-gym. A small boy on the swings.
The ice cream stand appears empty.

A police car is parked in the dirt lot. The abandoned building sits within the quiet field. Two police officers walk calmly along the grounds. One examines the discarded wheel chair lying sideways in the grass.
The sky is a dark purple. The house is closed up and quie The trees sway.
Jay rests in her bed. The wind blows steadily against the window. (CONTINUED)
A glass of juice and a plate of untouched food sit on her table - a pickle, Doritos and a white bread, crust-cut sandwich. There's a pill in the center of the napkin.

Jay stares at her body in the mirror - looking down as sh lifts the top edge of her underwear. She inspects herself Did I catch something? Shallow breathing - from fear. Examining under the bright light. A terrible rumbling begins. The bass and reverberations f the room... Jay looks down. Dirty clothes hang from chairs and shower bars. The sun shines through the bathroom window. A large patch negative space sits between Jay and the glass. Is something outside? The open bathroom door looks into the bedroom. Mirrors suggest empty space and shadows - things out of view. We wait for something to emerge. Smash!!! Jay jumps from fear as a ball thumps against the bathroom window. Taking a moment, she walks slowly towards the window. Jay peeks outside and sees a ball sitting in the grass be No one is visible outside.

We see a reverse shot of the neighbor boy hiding beneath window sill. He peeks back inside - covertly staring at J she walks to the sink and drinks straight from the faucet She's stooped and shaken, lapping at the water. The rumbling resumes - growing and doubling - feeding bac itself.
Jay walks along the main path with her backpack - staring the edges for something unknown. (CONTINUED)

Her POV tracking forward - a half-barren campus. Jay steps ahead. Nervous and cautious. The old buildings cast shadows overhead. A homeless man l quietly on the ground - peeking at the pretty girl. Jay sees a woman walking towards her on the path. Slow - possibly handicapped or a survivor of a stroke. Jay watches her out of the corner of her eye - the female student passes.

A man lectures at the front of the class. Chalk marks fil the board, along with the printed notation of "Fall Semes Sociology". 20 or so young adults sit throughout the room at desks an chairs - shorts and t-shirts fail to fend off the humidit Jay writes notes by pencil at the far edge of the classro The large windows to her right show the adjacent square. Jay bites on the edge of her pencil as she stares out at campus. The heat is visible. Sweat forms on her skin. She fans herself with a book. Greg sits on the opposite side of the classroom - near th back. He glances over at Jay - watching her with concern curiosity. Students walk lazily along the pathways near the square. watches them walk. The teacher's voice fades from her ear A few people relax on blankets in the grass - sharing foo talking. Jay sees an OLD WOMAN IN PAJAMAS walking very slowly - emerging from behind a row of trees. She focuses on the w as she hobbles along. The old lady steps directly across the blankets of studyi students, passing between couples without notice. She sta with her mouth open, looking directly at Jay. Jay takes a breath and watches with frightened eyes. The old woman walks closer and closer to the building, mo past some shrubs - approaching the windows. Jay tenses up. She stands awkwardly, grabs her bag and wa out of the classroom. (CONTINUED)
Uh, Jay, are you...? Jay closes the door without a word. Greg looks out to the hallway with concern.
OK. Well...

The heavy door opens a crack. Jay peeks out - just an eye She sees a few college students chatting together near th of the hall. An administrator pushes an AV cart out of a nearby classroom. Jay opens the door the rest of the way and steps into the hall. She looks around as she makes her way down the long passage. She eyes classes in session. Jay runs her hand along the wall. A few more steps onward Far off - at the opposite end of the hall - Jay sees the woman walk very slowly into view. Jay swallows hard as her breathing quickens. She watches curiosity and fear as the old woman stares ahead and move closer. Jay stops and waits. The CHATTING STUDENTS, a few girls laughing and gossiping the middle of the hall, fail to notice as the old woman w straight through their semi-circle. Jay stares, puzzled over the lack of attention to the old woman in pajamas. Though still far off, the old woman keeps coming closer.
Hello? The old woman doesn't respond. One of the chatting girls turns back and looks at Jay - g her a funny look. Do I know you?
Hello? Jay says nothing in reply. She fixates on the old woman. (CONTINUED)

The chatting girl shrugs and laughs, turning back to her friends. The old woman moves closer with crippled steps - mouth ag Scared, Jay turns and runs out the nearby exit doors. INT. JAY'S CAR - MORNING 4l Jay drives her tiny economy car through levels of the par structure. Descending, the camera reveals row after row o cars - students with backpacks - empty spaces - shadows. Jay appears tense and on-guard as she steers.

Jay walks past the Rackham "Bear" Fountain - kids throw pennies into the copper water. We follow behind her. She appears nervous - keeping her distance from others - scan the crowds. To her right, lions sprawl across the floor of their den. Giraffes step through the Egyptian exhibit as Jay crosses nearby walkway. EXT. CONCESSION STAND - DAY 42a Jay walks up to a large concession stand where Kelly and are working. In uniform, Kelly serves cups of cola and hotdogs to zoo- goers. Near the counter with supplies in hand, Paul notic Jay, and stops.
Hey, what are you doing here?
I need to talk to my sister. Paul rests the food package against the counter. He sees look of anxiety on Jay's face.
You ok?
Uh huh. Jay nods but she doesn't convince him. (CONTINUED)
We're both taking a break in a few minutes. If you want to sit down and wait... Kelly works feverishly in the background.
Ok. Jay looks around at the passers-by. Her neck and eyes bet her nervous energy and bird-like jitters. Paul pulls his damp uniform away from his chest in an att to feel some sort of breeze.
So hot out, isn't it?
Yeah. Jay has sweat on her forehead and arms, but she seems unaffected.
Want some ice cream? Jay looks back at the young man and nods. She really woul
Thank you.
Sitting in the underwater tunnel, Jay leans against the g rubs her temples and holds her face as she tries to relax Paul and Kelly watch alongside her.
Jay, what's going on?

There was an old woman at school today. She was staring at me... it seemed like she was following me. Jay stares down the tunnel at a group of strangers. Eyein them carefully. Kelly tries to hide her worried face.
Did you know her? (CONTINUED)
No, but she freaked me out. I didn't even go back to class. A few children in silhouette stare through the glass at t swimming polar bears. They shuffle along in awe.

Did she say something to you? Jay shakes her head. She looks down at the ice cream in h lap. She nibbles on the dessert as her sister and friend with quiet concern. They exchange a look between one anot
Hugh told me that he passed it onto me. That something was gonna follow me. The light from the water adds a pulsing shimmer to her fa
That's all bullshit, Jaime. Jay looks up at her sister and stares back with wide eyes
Yeah, I know. An enormous polar bear swims overhead - a passing shadow.
What exactly is supposed to be following you? Kelly glares at Paul - don't encourage this.
I don't know.
You should tell mom what you saw.
No.

Well, Jay, I'm worried about you. Jay focuses on her ice cream. Small delicate bites. Kelly watches her older sister pick at the dessert with a spoon like a young child - shoulders pointing inward. We see the trio together from outside the tunnel, through blue icy water. (CONTINUED)

The surface is visible just above, with pristine white gl walls behind them. Jay's figure appears stretched and distorted through the calm water. For this moment we hear only the pulsing of water within reverberating tank.
We gotta get back. Paul nods and Jay begins to rise from her stooped and sheltered position.
I could stay over tonight if it would make you feel better. Jay and Kelly simultaneously glance in Paul's direction.
(together) No. Paul shrugs.
Like on the couch or something.
No. Jay considers for a moment.
Maybe on the couch. Kelly rolls her eyes as Paul grins from a minor victory.
You should be more worried about waking up and finding Paul humping your leg.
That's true.
Um... The girls laugh.
I'm choosing to ignore these insults to my character... (CONTINUED)
(to Jay) Just keep your door locked. Jay nods, finishing her ice cream with a small grin.
I will stay up all night and keep an eye out for anything weird. Nothing's gonna happen. OK? Jay looks up at Paul and her sister - exhaling a light br

Yara sits on the toilet in her pajamas clipping her toena while chewing on a red vine. She appears focused. Jay and Kelly brush their teeth in front of the sink, lau to each other in the mirror. Kelly wears her old and tatt Amanda B’s Dance Team shirt. With toothpaste filled mouths...
Mom just went to bed.
Did she say anything?
No. She saw Paul on the couch. I don't think she cared. She had her bottle of merlot. Jay nods - understanding the subtext. More tooth-brushing

I keep thinking that something must be wrong with me. Even right now, it feels like I'm ten feet away from myself. The walls seem far away. I don't even like looking across the room. I feel... overwhelmed. Yara continues clipping, tapping her nail-tool against th of a tiny waste basket.
(matter of fact) It's probably anxiety.
Will it go away? (CONTINUED)
Yara nods - chewing more licorice.
But it can really fuck with you if you let it. So... don't. Jay spits into the sink.
The night is quiet. A few lights remain on inside the hou

An empty and dark street. No cars pass. Most households a asleep. Static shots of dark alleys, sickly oak trees, backyards illuminated by security lights. Rusted chain link fences. A dirty above-ground pool. Water sloshes gently through a intermittent filter.

On the television, a monster roars and a woman screams. Paul sits on the couch watching a black and white horror Blankets and pillows cover the couch. He eats popcorn and candy in the dim room. There's tinny gunfire from the television. Alien sounds reverberate. Paul tosses some more popcorn in his mouth as the on-scre hero embraces the damsel in distress. The woman on the tv cries and kisses the hero. Paul slump into his pillow with a sigh.

Kelly sleeps soundly in her bed. Yara is awake in her sle bag, reading Dostoyevsky via cell phone. The monster movie can be heard faintly. Through Kelly's window, we see the outer yard. It's mostl dark and very still. We hold on the window - moving close it - watching - waiting...  49 50 51 40.
Jay's mom is asleep on her bed. She's sprawled across the crumpled comforter in her night robe. A bottle of wine and empty glass sit on the dresser.

Changing into bedtime clothes, Jay glances out her window Across the alley, she sees the 11 year old neighbor boy s on her from his bedroom window. Jay jumps out of surprise. She covers herself and pulls t blinds down as the neighbor boy hides behind his own curt Bothered and momentarily frightened, Jay sits on the floo next to the window, listening to the television echo from hallway.

We follow behind Jay as she carries her blanket and pillo down the hallway into the living room. Still awake and watching a midnight movie, Paul sits up a fixes his hair as the pretty girl plops down on the small love-seat across from him.
I can't sleep - not in there.
That's ok. Sleep here. Jay smiles and pulls the covers over herself. They sit together - quiet - watching the television.
You really ok? Jay pauses - then looks at Paul. She shrugs her shoulders
Everything's gonna be cool. Jay nods her head. On the television, several soldiers lu giant monster into an electrical trap.
It's funny, I haven't spent the night over here since we were kids. (CONTINUED)
There's a reason for that. The pair crack smiles.
Shut up. I'm serious. It's cool to spend time with you.
Yeah.
We used to hang out all the time. Remember? Jay nods. *
At some point, it must've been weird for you having a guy friend that was younger than you.
I don't know. I think we just grew apart, right? Or you and Kelly got close. It's not a big deal, is it?
No. Not a big deal. * On the tv, a soldier flips a switch and sends a giant arc electricity into the towering monster. *
You were my first kiss, you know.
I know.
Was I not yours?
No. You were. *
And you kissed Kelly. She told me. You kissed two sisters... that's kind of gross. Paul grins. * The monster in the movie shrinks and disappears under the electrical charge. * (CONTINUED)
Do you remember that time we found all the porno magazines in the alley by Barry's Pizza?
Yes. Jay shakes her head with a smile - silly memories. *
We were such stupid kids.
Ridiculous. *
We're all sitting on Greg's front lawn with a dozen dirty magazines sprawled everywhere and we're laughing... Jay chuckles at the memory.
We had no idea how terrible it was. Paul starts to laugh. *
And Greg's mom?! Remember her face when she came outside and saw us all sitting around reading that shit? Jay laughs along with Paul. *
She scooped them up so fast. Called my mom too. Me and Kelly got a sex ed lecture the next day.
I got one too. * Jay and Paul smile to each other from across the room. * They hear the sound of glass breaking.
What the fuck? Paul stares at Jay - worried.
Go look. (CONTINUED)

Paul hesitates. He jumps up and steps to the edge of the - trying to determine where it came from. Jay watches, scared, behind the covers on the love-seat. Paul turns the corner, exiting the living room. Jay waits. Heroic and celebratory music pours from the tv as the cre roll. Jay scans the room - the windows. A moment later, Paul returns. He stands at the corner of large room.
There's a broken window in the kitchen, but nobody's there.
Are you sure? You looked around?
Yes. Jay doesn't appear comforted.
Whoever broke it ran away.
We should call the police.
I'm gonna wake up your sister. She should probably call.
Paul steps out of view - heading for Kelly's room.
I'm surprised they slept through that.
(speaking to no one) Yeah. Jay sits alone on the couch. She pulls the blanket from h legs - adjusting on the small couch. (CONTINUED)
Silence. Jay stands up and walks slowly towards the edge of the ro She rounds the corner - stepping closer and closer to the kitchen.

Jay hesitantly peeks inside the kitchen doorway. A HALF-NAKED YOUNG WOMAN, with a slight resemblance to Ja walks very slowly towards her. Small steps. She's missing her two front teeth, while urinating throug brown suede skirt. Dark circles around her eyes. A tube sock on one foot. Th other bare. Immodest and vulgar. Jay chokes on a scream and backs away. She knocks over some household nick-knacks as she crosses dining room. Rushing towards the stairwell - Jay runs up to the home's second floor. A mad dash.
Jay reaches the top landing and races towards the large r room. Inside, she slams the door shut, locks it and backs towards the far wall. She breathes and listens. Footsteps. A knock on the door.
(behind door) Jay? Jay doesn't say a word. She sits still. Waiting.
(behind door) Jay, can you open the door? Jay shakes her head.
(behind door) What's going on? (CONTINUED)
It's in the house.
(behind door) There's nothing in the house, Jay.
I saw it.
(behind door) Just open the door, OK? Jay watches as the door-knob rattles - then stops.
It's in the kitchen.
(behind door) I'm not gonna let anything happen to you. Open the door and we'll figure it out. Jay doesn't move.
(behind door) There's nothing here. Jay gets up and slowly walks to the door. She reaches for handle and turns it. Peeking out, she sees Paul and Kelly standing alone.
Get in here. Jay waves them into the room. Once inside, she closes and locks the door. Kelly stands with arms crossed, while Paul sits on the ed a chair.
Jay, why don't you sit down? Jay paces and looks from the door to the second-story win She crumbles down onto the floor. Kelly and Paul are silent. (CONTINUED)
I need water. Oh my god I need some water.
I'll get you some.
No. Stay here. Jay shivers and holds herself.
Is something wrong with me?
Somebody broke the window. That really happened.
Yeah, but I saw a girl in the kitchen. Jay pushes herself against the wall - almost in shock. Ke comes over and rubs her shoulder.
I love you. You're ok. It's gonna be alright.
You don't believe me.
Not all of it... no. But some of it. There's a tapping sound at the door. All three kids turn stare. The doorknob shakes a bit. Almost turns - but stop

Mom? Knock. Knock. Knock. Three soft taps on the door. Jay crawls across the floor towards the window, shushing sister with a panicked gesture. Worried, Paul picks up a broom from the corner of the roo stands near the door - wooden stick raised.
Mom, is that you? Jay shakes her head. (CONTINUED)
(behind door) No. It's me.
Yara?
Yup. Kelly stands and approaches the door. She unlocks it, gra the doorknob and turns...

Don't open the door. Kelly opens the door revealing... Yara, sleepy-eyed and bored, stands in the doorway, holdi her glasses. She rubs the sleep from her eyes, while chew on a red vine dangling from her mouth.

See? Everything's ok. Suddenly - A VERY LARGE MAN peeks out from behind Yara's shoulder - bending his head down into the door frame like some kind giant. He stares at Jay. Jay screams as the large man follows Yara into the room - remaining just inches behind the petite young woman. Paul looks at Jay - confused. No one but Jay sees the lon limbed giant moving closer. Jay rushes to the back window, opens it, pushes out the s and crawls through. Kelly, Paul and Yara run towards her, trying to hold her
Jay, be careful!
Hey, wait!
Jay pulls her arm away and steps onto the edge of the roo She stands, looking down. (CONTINUED)

The large man walks very slowly towards her, visible thro the frame of the window - over Paul, Yara and Kelly's shoulders. Jay turns and steps along the edge of the roof towards th side of the house. Kelly looks out the window as Jay moves from view.
Jay! What are you doing?!

(to Kelly) I'll get her. Paul runs into the hallway - disappearing down the stairw Jay lowers herself to the fence and hops into the alleywa A boy's bicycle leans against the neighbor's house. Jay g it, jumps on and rides off into the street.

Greg sits with a pretty girl in his open garage, smoking joint. They're flirting - his hand on her leg. Greg notices Jay pedaling the kid's bike into the street. watches, puzzled, as she rides off. Paul emerges from the front door.

Jay rides the bike into the middle of the park. She stops an open area near the swings and an old spider-web jungle Rusted cartoon faces hover over the play area on the tops the gym's posts. The chains of the swings rattle in the wind. Jay steps off the bike and lays it down on the sandy grou She looks around at the open park. Large elm trees and di paths spread out around the grassy patches of the block. Jay watches for movement. It's quiet and still. She walks across the lot towards the swings and sits down nearly in shock - trying to calm herself - looking for something grounded and real. She starts to swing - very lightly. A young woman in paja alone in the night. (CONTINUED)

Her feet slide across the sand and she holds them higher. Jay watches the park. Swinging. Forward. Back. A dog barks in the distance. Crickets chir The dog stops barking. It's quiet again. The swing creaks quietly - the sound echoes across the tr Jay sees a figure approaching through the trees - partial hidden by the darkness. She stops the swing and watches - afraid - ready to run.
Jay! Kelly, Paul and Yara emerge from the darkness of the park Meeting in the open lot, Kelly runs up to Jay.
You could've hurt yourself! What are you doing? The sisters hug. Amid their embrace, they whisper...
(whispers) I'm really scared, Kel.
(whispers) Me too, but we'll figure it out.
(whispers) You can't tell mom. She'll freak out and she won't believe me.
(whispers) I know. It's ok.
What were you running away from? Jay sees something. A silhouette moves through the street eyes turn towards the approaching shape.
Do you see that? (CONTINUED)
I do.
It's... a person. Stepping into the light from nearby street lamps - Greg emerges from the darkness.
Greg?
What the hell's going on? Jay struggles to find a response.
Are you ok? Jay nods. Paul glares at Greg - unnoticed.
Somebody broke into their house.
Shit. Did you call the police? Jay shakes her head no.
I don't want to go home.
Where do you wanna go? Jay exhales - looking up at Kelly.
I need to find him.
The person who broke into your house?
No.
Hugh? Jay nods. It's a small and meek response from a normally strong young woman.
What did he really do to you? (CONTINUED)
Jay shakes her head and shrugs, looking down at the groun rubbing her eyes with her hand. Kelly offers Greg a look - let Jay be.
(quiet) Ok. The gang stands around in silence - amidst the quiet park Greg turns and starts to walk away. Jay notices him walki off.
Are you leaving?

No, I'm getting my car. Somebody's gotta drive, right? Greg jogs off. Kelly and Jay sit down on the edge of the merry-go-round looking out at the shadowy park. The sky h nearly achieved its pre-dawn blue.

Jay sits in the passenger seat while Greg drives. Paul, Y and Kelly sit in the back. Yara snacks on a large donut, reading from her phone. Chocolate on her fingers. The car drives into the inner city. The neighborhoods bec poorer - more decayed and urban. Jay sees a pair of middle-aged women walking carts down t street. A third and older woman trails behind them. Jay notices her watching their car as they pass. The sound of Greg's engine grows louder - feeding back on itself unnaturally. Further on, Jay sees a homeless man standing behind a telephone pole on the side of the road. The man is perfec divided by, and almost hiding behind the pole. They pass him and continue on.

Greg's car pulls up and stops in front of an old inner-ci house. It sits alongside an overgrown field with a distan view of the towering Renaissance Center. Early morning fog drifts across the face of the brick building. (CONTINUED)
A patch of police tape is strung across the front door. A on the lawn reads: FOR RENT.

Paul stands on the gas meter pulling a window open. Jay, Kelly and Yara stand along the back wall of the house, lo around at the weed-filled lawn and adjoining backyards. As Paul crawls inside, we hear the jingle of clinking can a bell rattle. A dog begins to bark loudly from a distant yard. Jay notices an old woman peeking out from behind a neighb house. The woman stares suspiciously, then disappears. Paul opens the back door, gesturing for the gang to enter

location: LIVING/DINING ROOM OF HUGH'S DETROIT HOME

text: The camera pushes forward through a dark hall. Tiny beams of morning light shine through the covered win Large swathes of shadow obscure the details of the dim sp A dusty mist fills the air. Piles of debris rest on the coffee table. Couch cushions flipped. The television is face down on the floor. Jay and Greg walk cautiously into the dark living room. Moving to the curtain-covered bay window, Jay stares at a collection of cans, bottles and bells that hang from stri across the entire length. She runs her hand over the primitive alarm. Clink Clink jingle jingle. Greg discovers a similar string of cans and bells across smaller side window.

Kelly rifles through drawers and checks the medicine cabi She finds several bottles of pills. The labels have been off. Bits of daylight shine through a tiny window above the sh Kelly sees a bloody razor blade on the floor near a stack towels.  62 63 64 65 53.
Yara opens the fridge and makes a funny face at the sight open leftovers and rotten fruit.
I don't think he spent a lot of time here.

Kelly notices a crack in the wall of the bathroom. She ru her hand along the split in the dry-wall. Kelly applies s pressure and a large piece of wall falls away - revealing hole leading to the adjoining room. Jay peeks through the hole to her sister.
He told me never to go into a room that didn't have more than one way out. Kelly shakes her head - surprised by the oddness of the situation.

Paul enters the upstairs bedroom. Water-stains line the w An old mattress sits on the floor. Debris and clothes box fill the space. Paul digs carefully through the cardboard boxes - sorting through a few remaining articles of clothes. A couple pai socks. Some underwear.

Standing on the counter, Yara digs through the upper cabi using her cell phone to illuminate the junk inside. Greg nearby, looking up at her legs. Admiring. Yara peeks into the cabinet. Pushing aside a dusty row of mugs... A cockroach runs out and scampers across her hand.
Ebhh!! Fuck! Yara shakes her hand in disgust. Greg chuckles.  66 67 54.
Kelly walks alone through the garbage filled cellar. The camera pushes slowly through the dusty shadows toward a g level window. There's tension as we near the sun-misted g Nothing passes.

Under some crumpled and stained tissue paper, Paul discov small stack of porn magazines. He lifts them and sits on the edge of the bed, sifting th the various covers. He selects one and casually flips through the magazine - perusing a nude woman's pictorial. Jay enters the bedroom and sees him. She shakes her head moves to the bedroom's far window. It's taped over with newspapers and comic book pages. A few tears allow some morning light into Hugh's grim-looking sleep quarters. Jay peeks through a hole in the comic book page, looking at the nearby field. She sees a homeless man walking thro the tall grass. He disappears behind a tree. Jay backs aw quickly, bumping the string of cans with her arm. Paul turns another page and finds a loose photo wedged in He pulls the picture out and examines it.
Hey, look at this.
What?

Is this him? Jay moves to the bed and looks down at the photo in Paul' hand. She sees a younger, teenage-version of Hugh with so old girlfriend. They both have bad haircuts. The girl, a cheerleader, is wearing a boy's oversized high school letterman jacket. It reads: Lawson Vikings.
Do you recognize the letterman jacket?
Lawson High School. Paul nods in agreement. (CONTINUED)
Somebody's gonna know his real name. Jay looks closely at Hugh's smiling face.
Down a long, locker-filled hallway, Greg and Jay walk tog towards the main office. A few kids pass them, walking to class - dodging work.

Through a medium-sized window in the hall, we see a coupl high school kids making out behind a tree - only pieces o action from a distance. A teen boy in ugly clothes walks eating an apple. The camera pans, crossing the hall and focusing on the ne main office.

Through the glass we watch as Jay and Greg speak with a c of school employees. The photo sits on the counter betwee them. One woman grabs a large book from a shelf, opens it and f through pages as a man types slowly on his old computer. watches. Jay stops and turns, looking out past us and the camera, scanning the area - she is constantly on guard. Jay turns back and listens as the woman talks. The camera pans again, back towards the window. Outside, the couple are still kissing behind the tree. A YOUNG WOMAN WITH RED HAIR is walking towards the buildi carrying a backpack. A few teen girlfriends cross the window, laughing and chatting.

Paul and Kelly sit in the back seat of the car like kids waiting for their parents. Yara sleeps on Kelly's shoulde Greg and Jay open their doors and hop into the front. The high school building is visible through the front win (CONTINUED)
Did they know?
Yup.
His real name's Jeff. In the distance, the young redhead with a backpack is vis walking towards the car. She's quite far away. No one see her.
Not Hugh?
(shaking his head) Jeff Redmond.
Do we tell the police? Greg starts the car. The radio comes on - quiet. A seat-b alarm dings repeatedly. Greg buckles up - Jay doesn't.

No. The redhead walks closer as Greg backs the car up and pul out of the school lot. No one sees her, except us (and probably only some of us). Paul sees Jay and Greg share a moment of eye contact. Gre rubs Jay's shoulder for comfort. Paul makes a face - slightly irritated.

Greg's car pulls up in front of a large upper-middle-clas house on the more rural edge of the county. Well manicure lawns enhance the neighborhood's stature. Jay climbs out of the car and walks up to the front door. friends pile out of the car and stand around it, like a r gang from a B-picture version of "West Side Story". Jay rings the bell and waits. She looks down the street - watching the empty road. The door opens and a friendly middle-aged woman in a rump shirt and "mom jeans" greets Jay. MRS. REDMOND smiles and looks to her. (CONTINUED)
Hello. Jay stares at the woman - taken aback. Mrs. Redmond is a ringer for the naked woman seen earlier at the abandoned warehouse.
Hi. Um. Is Jeff here?
Yeah. He is. Um... Do you wanna come in?
Yeah. Mrs. Redmond glances back at Jay's friends by the car.
Your friends?
That'd be great. Jay waves her sister and friends over.
Mrs. Redmond leads Jay and her friends down a long hallwa the back of the house. They reach a doorway. Mrs. Redmond knocks.
Hey Jeff, you got friends here. Silence.
Jeff.
Yeah mom. I'm coming. The door unlocks and opens. Jeff looks out past his mom t Jay and her gang. His face reveals the awkwardness and st of the moment. He tries to hide it from his mother.
Hey. Jay looks back at him - waiting for something. (CONTINUED)
